This could have been such a better film with a slightly lighter touch and less self-indulgence from the director. Still though it's solid enough and worth a watch.

I enjoyed The Invisibile Guest, but I think I'd have enjoyed it more had I not known the twist before starting to watch it. The photos on here give away the twist far too easily. Having said that, it doesn't take much working out; the film is as much about the howdunit as the whodunit.

Defense attorney Virginia Goodman arrives at the apartment of businessman Adrián Doria. He's out on bail for the murder of his lover, Laura Vidal. The prosecutor has a new witness and he has three hours before going back to court. He was being blackmailed. He was knocked out and woke up to the police finding him with her dead body.This opens with a fine premise and it does not let go. It get more and more twisty. There is higher tension culminating to the amazing moment the couple finds the phone in the couch. The movie does level off to some extent. It becomes a bit too complicated. One needs to really feel for Doria but that character is ice cold. It would have been more compelling for him to be good rooting material and then have the twist turn him. Still, I do like this noirish mystery thriller. There is some fun darkness to this story. As for the final twist, it's a little too obvious too soon. It's the obvious twist and there are a few too many spotlights on it.

First of all, I was really hopeful towards this movie, it seemed like on ok premise at start but story seemed to head for downfall after 1/3 of movie, which almost forced me to quit it. Since I started watching it I said why not, I wasn't expecting Agatha Christie material after all. I have no idea why does it have so much positive reviews because it was super predictable, it was forced in twists and it has ended with actually no logic - recording the evidence and whole story WITHOUT police surveillance. It only pointed out to the thing we didn't see at the end - culprit was released because of lack of evidence, since such collected evidence is considered illegal in whole civil law and guilt can not be based on it. Maybe that was post-ending twist?Also pointing out on a map in newspapers where the car was pushed in lake but main villain can not guess from the pictures was it or wasn't it there? I can't recall when was main character made a cartographer expert - but after one drive, during the night he hit the spot like a champ, real pirate x. Super dumb actually.Thank you but next time ask actual lawyer or judge or prosecutor before actually hitting on a justice card. I'm giving it 2*s because there are worse movies. I am not giving reviews most of the time but I needed to give to this one because most are either fake or are made from twilight fans.

reviews.review_title: This is my number one recommendation to all my friends
reviews.content: These European Netflix (and other) productions just keep on getting better and better. Watching stuff like this just makes me excited for the future of cinema, outside Hollywood.If you haven't watched, just go! This is one you should jump headfirst without knowing anything, and you shouldn't get your hopes up to much, it´s not the greatest of all timeIf you have, The only negative part is that I can never watch it again for the first timeI could argue that I spotted some inconsistencies or that I saw it coming but, in fact, I would just be lying to myself to feel smart, I was "no way'ing" until the very end, keeping me on the edge of my sofa.And it's also in Spanish as a bonusBrilliant.

A smart, sophisticated & skilfully structured mystery thriller that utilises its genre elements to great effect, The Invisible Guest (also known as Contratiempo) comes jam-packed with an endless barrage of twists n turns, and is a thoroughly riveting cinematic ride from the get-go.Written & directed by Oriol Paulo, the events are narrated in a manner that only amplifies our interest as plot progresses, and though Paulo attempts to throw us off the curve several times with never-ending twists, he is still aware of where to draw the line and not derail everything.What begins as a simple exercise in witness preparation escalates into something more personal as we dive into the events that led to this particular moment, each new perspective unearths new details, and it compels us to start playing detective by trying to connect the dots & solve the mystery.The neat production design, polished camerawork & slick editing work in harmony to give the whole production a sophisticated touch n feel. Performances are good enough to stay out of complaint zone. The score shines best in the final moments, which in itself is immensely satisfying in retrospect and aptly ties up all loose ends.Overall, The Invisible Guest flirts with the absurd at times and takes slight leeway with the plot to make itself work but the journey is worth it. A thrilling, suspenseful & consistently engaging example of its genre that only gets better & more involving with time, and finally concludes with a thumping finale, Oriol Paulo's sophomore feature comes definitely recommended.
I don't get people taste of movies these days, that was super boring movie, it was so slow with no interesting moments..till the end .. I don't recommend watch it unless if you need to sleep!

reviews.review_title: This Movie will make you feel Blind
reviews.content:
A tight, pacy 1 hour 40 odd minutes thriller.While watching a thriller, our minds tend to move faster than the pace of the film to find out who did it or what actually happened. This is the reason why thrillers work if they don't follow your line of thought. This movie will not follow your line of thought. You will be fooled. Everything will be right in front of you but you will be made to stare somewhere else. That's the law of Magic.
Observe every scene very carefully and you might start asking questions to yourself as the movie goes on and at certain scenes or characters might even confuse you but you won't be able to expect that 'What the..' climax.If you like this film, do watch 'El Cuerpo' and 'Crime D'amour'.

reviews.review_title: Easily a 8/10 if the film was tweaked a little bit more
reviews.content: There were a lot of places where it was hard to watch as the story dragged on too muchShould you watch it? Yes, but keep in mind in that there are a lot of twists and turns - most of them unnecessary but in the end you will get some closure.

Let's admit it. The great generation of great Spaniards actors died with Alfredo Landa. And yes, Javier Bardem can convince you at times, but here comes Penelope Cruz to trash the party. But what made Spaniard actors good was the fact that they knew what they were good act, which is to reflect the society where they grew up. Watch Antonio Banderas in an American action movie and then in an Spanish film and you will understand fully what I am talking about.I would not say that thrillers are something that Spanish is famous for. And yes, I was amazed by "Los cronocrímenes", but I place that one on sci/fi, and yes, I loved "REC", but again falls under the sci/fi umbrella, and yes, there is a myriad of great Spanish-speaking thrillers ("El secreto de sus ojos")...but they are not "made in Spain". So when you heard about an Spanish thriller made by Spaniards and with Spanish actors...well, I raised my eyebrown but wanted to give it a try.And boy was I glad I did it, and you will, too. I watched mine (as always) in original Spanish with English subtitles and love it. Most of the actors (I will come to that later) were just great, completely believable. The plot, that would made Hitchcock proud, is so open that only at the very end you really know what is going on. You have a story line, a few levels of complexity, and your final twist. What else could you wish for?Well...there are some, minor things, that I could have wished for. I don't like when events on a movie are forced so the actors follow a certain path. Don't worry, I don't do spoilers period, but here I am going to take you to the edge of one to explain what I mean: You cannot go to any decent hotel and check into a room that has been booked by someone else, unless your name is somewhere around there. I know so because sometimes my name has been misspelled by the booking agent in my company and I almost could not use a room booked for me. So when this happens in a movie that does not require for me to suspend disbelief...well, it breaks the spell. And worst still, these are things that could been easily fixed.Then is the actors. It seems that Jose Coronado is some sort of Spanish washed out and flushed Robert DeNiro that recently has been used to add weight to a movie. Coronado has been on great movies, but recently it seems to me he is a bit more than a token to get Spaniards to watch a movie. Same happens here. Mario Casas and Ana Wagener steal the show. The rest are good too, but I felt that Coronado could have done so much more with his role. I felt a missed opportunity there.And the plot, while truly great, could have been even more. It gets predictable towards the end, and it didn't need to be. There were some lines that could have been expanded but didn't, and that would earn the full marks that the main actors so much deserved.But still this is a fantastic movie and, if you love thrillers as much as I do, this one will not disappoint.

reviews.review_title: One of the most suspense films ever made.
reviews.content: This film was beast, it was so intense and so fast-paced that I could barely make up with it's pacing. The storyline is quite complex, but storyelling is very clear and easy, so it's not difficult to understand. I truly loved it.

It's just great. Great casting. Great Screenplay and great of all. I just can't find the final twist till the very end they reveal it.it just ended awesome.It's highly recommended from me.#FilmFreak
Twitter- @Filmfreak19.

Before watching the remake I saw this movie and trust me I was constantly having goosebumps. I dont know if I will see the remake because I dont want ruin this experience of mine if the remake wouldn't match my expectations like this movie did.The beauty of this movie is its story and also its twists and some very good performances.it could be my best suspense thriller I watched till date.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR MYSTRY THRILLER LOVERS

reviews.review_title: One of the best thrillers ever seen

Unexpected end with great surprises. The landscapes and the performance of each actor were top. If you
liked it don't miss the other great Spanish series production La casa de Papel.
9/10

reviews.content: THIS MOVIE WILL KEEP YOU ON YOUR NERVE ALL THE TIME.

reviews.review_title: The best I've seen in quite some time
reviews.content: One of the very best murder mysteries/thrillers I've seen in a long time. It's in Spanish, but even the English subtitles are brisk and to the point and do not detract from enjoying this remarkable film. The twists and turns took me all the way to the last few seconds. It was almost like a grand banquet complete with appetizers, soup and salads, an extraordinary entree and the final, exquisite dessert of an ending. Completely satisfying. I gave it a 10 only because I couldn't choose 11 or 12.

It is certainly known by facts that this is not the best film of Paulo, however, his intriguely enigmatic with twisting that surrounds this tale, grips you on the edge, keeping you captivated from the beginning to end until truth is revealed.The spectator is constantly led out by his assumptions and theories that get him closer to the truth, trying desperately to excavate more and more to pursue the real gist of the story.The end can be described as quite dull and fully load with dismal gloomfests, which makes you look like unclever at some point until you capable of uncover the loose ends that are subsequently hidden in the story. Several wonderings may arise in order to explain these obvious loose ends. Why should Mr. Doria hire a witness expert lawyer to "save" his life and clean up his name without deeply investigating in advance who she is, where does she come from and so on? Have Felix and his client (Mr. Doria) been in touch with Virginia before the meeting? Are they aware about exact meeting date? Does Tomas Garrido's wife have the ability and astuteness to supplant a brilliant lawyer without looked suspicious for not even a second? You can see real Virginia showing up at his door two or three hours later than the fake one(so late), which is hardly difficult to understand and explain.In general, entertaining inspite of the poor acting and loose ends. Predicted situations are the leaders of this common and not too convoluted film as it tries to seem, turned into another common livid crime thriller.

It has been a long time since I haven't been that amazed. A great thriller, I wonder why I had never heard about it before... Thank you, movie team, for these great 2 hours I spent watching it.
Definitely a must see.
Amazing movie. Unpredictable like a good mistery movie should be.

reviews.review_title: Too many twist and plot holes
reviews.content:
Every story has a beginning, a middle and an end.This film can be summed up in those 3 parts as an excellent beginning, an intriguing middle and a disappointing end.The plethora of story pivots throw you off the scent from the obvious plot holes that adorn an otherwise interesting story.
If you're the sort of person who doesn't dig into every finer detail of a movie, then you'll enjoy this as a tense thriller.However there are so many scenes that are blatantly unviable because if the police investigated it the film would end there and then.The ending feels similar to Usual Suspects, but by then you've already guessed what is going to happen and hope somehow that it doesn't.

reviews.review_title: Not the best mystery film but not the worst either
reviews.content: For someone who has seen a lot of mystery films and is a big fan of Hitchcock, this film failed to shock to me in it's finale. It tries too hard to sustain the suspense, which lowers the attention and the engagement of the viewer. The rapid changing of facts or stories does not help either. That being said it's still a pretty watchable film and if someone is new to this genre then they might enjoy it more than I did.

Oriol Paulo directed this film and another called "The Body" or "El Cuerpo", an earlier film. "The Invisible Guest" is truly a masterpiece and if anyone hasn't seen "The body" by the same director then I strongly recommend watching "The Body" before watching "The Invisible Guest" so as not to be underwhelmed. This director and this film, in particular, will be on my foremost recommendations to anyone who requests a good film to watch.

A Spanish thriller with more twists than a snake path. One in particular was a real stunner. The cast are perfect, especially Mario Casas and Ana Wagener.I just stumbled upon this by accident, never knew anything about it, a great surprise.By the way...was that the Overlook Hotel?

Fav Spanish film since Cell 211. As a fan of thrillers full of twists i had a blast! One of the best thriller ive seen in a while. The way things are built up in this movie is amazing. Gripping from start to end! Excelente!

You know those films where the protagonists do something so stupid, so unbelievable and so illogical? And, you know when the whole film is based on that premise? And you know when you lose all interest in everything from that point, because you think this is just an absurd plot device to make things dramatic?
Well this is one of those films.
Why anyone in their right mind who do what the main characters did, especially as they are bright, intelligent people, is beyond me.
This is now the third time I have tried watching this film and I end up stopping a third of the way through thinking...morons, they deserve everything they get.

reviews.review_title: GAVE ME ALFRED HITCHCOCK THROUGH AND THROUGH AND I LOVED IT!
reviews.content:
This was sooooo very Alfred Hitchcock not just because it was a dialogue heavy mystery thriller but also the way the film was made it had elements when it felt like horror and not just a thriller and the whole premise of the plot is also massively Hitchcock-esque which I LOVEDDDD!!! I'm a big Noir fan and this gave me sooo much of that!!!SPOILERSSS FROM HERE ON::***********
I found the scene very scary when the protagonist's story about him being in the hotel room shows a guy in the cupboard watching the protagonist stand in the room - I found that very scary!! Although later we find out that was all a lie and he was alone in the room.
I also found it very scary towards the end just as when the lawyer is leaving the protagonist's room I felt really scared for her I thought at any moment this guy could turn so the whole idea of anything could happen scared me!
I also found it really creepy+scary when the woman started removing her contacts and wig in the end lool.. I can watch loooads of horror movies but what really scares is psychological thriller :(=

reviews.content: Now I'm of the opinion that Spain has as much talent as Hollywood, if not better. The plot in this movie is awesome and the cast gave it a believable act. If suspense thrillers are your thing, I highly recommend this one.

If you are in search of a super thriller. This is it ! The movie want us to go with its flow from the start to end. Awsome cinematography. Awsome direction. Though we can somewhat judge the climax scenes before, the movie needs a great appreciation.

reviews.review_title: Best Mystery Thriller I've Seen In Years
reviews.content: I'm an avid fan of thriller movies and this one has been on my list for weeks. I regret not watching it sooner. This story is very very intricate but also easy enough to follow. I can't really give a summary of the things that happen without giving away one or more of the several twists, but I CAN say this film has just about everything. It's mysterious, thrilling, exciting, a bit sad and right when you think the twists and turns are at a climax they just keep on going. It has elements of a "who dunnit" murder mystery along the way as well.If you are a fan of any sort of crime/murder thriller then DO NOT miss this movie. I'm not exaggerating when I say it's the best crime thriller I've seen in years, and I've watched about 100 in the last 8 months. Right now I'm even rambling about it because I just can't say enough about how great it is. Trust me, just watch it. You won't regret it.

Very questionable actions by protagonist, a random guy who makes no attempt to arouse sympathy from the beginning of the film; in aggregate with less than realistic course of events puts this brummagem below par compared to a proper mystery titles.Expressionless.

Going into this movie, I wasn't sure what to expect. The audience ratings were solid, yet the critic reviews were a little underwhelming in comparison, which only goes to show - always trust the PEOPLE over the critics! Thriller movies that fall under the mystery/suspense category are often hit-and-miss. Many of them miss the mark, particularly these days. This is why it's all the more satisfying when you stumble upon one that truly hits the spot, and manages to find that magic formula. 'The Invisible Guest' is a perfect example of that.The best thing about this film is it's ability to combine plausibility with unpredictability. Often, when Thriller/Mystery movies fall short, it's usually either a result of their inability to keep the audience guessing, or their excessive use of 'dramatic license' which frequently results in glaringly obvious plot holes and all too predictable 'plot twists' that feel forced and lazy. The truly captivating thing about this film is that much of the mystery comes as much from the minds of the characters as it does from the overall plot. It doesn't need to resort to far-fetched storylines or ridiculous twists to be shocking - because the nature of the conversation that takes place between two of the main characters - Adrian Dora and the excellent Virginia Goodman - naturally takes you on a journey (or several journeys) that ultimately leads you down blind alleys and into intensely dramatic territory, without ever having to compromise the believability of the plot.If you're a fan of those classic unpredictable and tension-filled Mystery Thrillers that keep you sat and guessing on the edge of your seat throughout - such as Seven, Gone Girl, Zodiac etc - then 'The Invisible Guest' is a must-see for you. The more the storyline develops and the mystery builds, the more compelling and captivating it becomes. Plus, just as with any great Mystery Thriller, the ending or 'final act' will leave you just as shocked and gobsmacked as you were after witnessing the climactic final moments of 'Seven'... ("what's in the box?!")All in all, I give this film a solid 9/10. The only reason it isn't higher is because the 10/10 scores should be reserved for those movies that very much fall into the 'among the best of all time' category. Whilst 'The Invisible Guest' doesn't quite make it into that category, it remains, in my opinion, one of the most captivating, mind-blowing, well crafted and truly shocking Thrillers to reach our screens since David Fincher's 'Gone Girl'.Do yourself a favour - cancel any plans you may have this evening, stay home, and watch the truly exceptional 'The Invisible Guest'...You can thank me later.

Invisible guest is my 1st Spanish thrille.r. Since then, I become a fan of Spanish movie. Just like most of the audience, I am stunned with coming up with 'wa' in the ending. It is the movie of great ingenuity. The setting is perfect with unexpected twists and turns. Although it is not a horror film, the atmosphere still makes me shudder. Definitely It is thrilling and yet brainstorming. The twisted plot will lead you to various possibilities. Whenever you think that the truth is revealed, you will be slammed! I am 100% recommend to anyone who loves reasoning and brainstorming. Now I find a lots of thrillers trying to copy the twisted plot from it, none of them could beat this one!

reviews.review_title: A Gem Of Modern Spanish Cinema
reviews.content: Just an amazing film! An incredible murder misery with twists and turns at every corner. A great script, superb acting, interesting editing choices and beautifully shot. An all around great movie executed perfectly.

A film starring Mario Casas - the idol of teenagers who dream of love as in "Tres metros sobre el cielo". And it's such a good role that I'll risk saying it's one of the best Spanish-language films I've ever seen.

reviews.content: The assured, at times bombastic direction, as well as the passionate performances, help distract from the more implausible aspects of the plot.

Sometimes Spain comes up with very good movies. This is one, if you like some Hitchcock and a nasty plot that makes you applaud out of joy at the end. There is only one thing a viewer has to do and that´s not to look too closely at everything. It might spoil the fun.
This movie is a masterpiece. The actors performance is outstanding and the plot is unpredictable and mind-blowing.

reviews.review_title: you can never have a better suspense nowadays then this one and watch it for Mario

reviews.review_title: Not too Tough to Figure Out but Enjoyable
reviews.content: First of all, the actors are very good. There is a little overacting by one character, imo, but overall a very talented cast. It is also shot very nicely. If you are new to the genre, you might not see the "twist", but if you watch a lot of mysteries or thrillers odds are it will become glaringly obvious very early. If you work it out early on, you might begin to feel the way I did (or maybe not) but it started to become a bit tedious. It is not a waste of time or terrible, but neither is it mind blowing or anything you haven't seen before if you watch this type of movie or program a lot. I would recommend it for a rainy day or if your in the mood for an atmospheric thriller, but just know the secret isn't that tough to work out so it might end up being more of a drama than a mystery.
All i can say is wow the second best spanish movie i ever watched after the body...

reviews.review_title: A story about consequences, hard choice and lethal situations where the characters are forced to play life and death in order to have justice or keep their lives.
reviews.content: I rarely watch detectives but when I encounter a good one I cannot believe how well it is constructed. We definitely need more movies like this. There is a cat and mouse game that unravel plot twists that blow minds. We see how one accident is seen from different perspectives, how the same witness can tell different stories about the same accident. While watching the movie you have no idea who is the guilty one and who is the victim but once the film progresses you understand that there are no victims only guilty people that try to survive. The main character is all of us. Put in a hard situation he acts from passion, takes his decision in a matter of a second. The consequences follow him but he still floats. Or is he? That's the question. I would have given a 10 but I knew what's going on even if they are trying to hide it and boy oh boy, they hide it so well that even I couldn't foreseen the main twist that decides if the main character will get his way or how beautiful people around him manage to counter his decisions. Interesting and chilling, this story gives you an image of how one action can lead to another and brings demise so fast that you can't even see it miles away.

"The Invisible Guest" brings a welcome and largely unparalleled level of complexity to a mystery/thriller. The complexity of the plot rivals some of my favorite films, such as "Courage Under Fire" and "Basic." Unfortunately, much of the complexity and plot reversals involve improbable coincidences, which detract from their dramatic impact. The performances are believable, particularly by Wagener and Coronado. However, the central character is depicted as selfish, self-absorbed and remorseless. The film might be stronger if we were to see a positive side to his character. Similarly, we don't see enough of the femme fatale to understand the central character's fascination with her, particularly as we see two widely different perceptions of their relationship. The basic story concerns a murder committed inside a locked room. That mystery is set up very well and believably. The cinematographer successfully sets up a dreary, grey, cold setting. The clothes are grey. The mood is grey. The cars are grey. The only visual element that contrasts is the vivid white hair of one of the characters.
Adrián Doria is a wealthy businessman named "Man of the Year" for his high-tech companies and trade agreements with Asian markets. He met with Virginia Goodman,

Adrián Doria, a wealthy businessman named Man of the Year for his high-tech company and his trade deals with the Asian market, meets Virginia Goodman, a veteran lawyer specializing in witness preparation and court filing, recommended by Adrián's lawyer, Felix Leiva, for purposes to create a credible defense, Arrested by the police in a mountain hotel room with the corpse of his lover by his side, photographer Laura Vidal, Adrián talks about Virginia about the crime and his relationship with Laura, revealing that they both had a car accident where a man named Daniel Garrido died, in a puzzle where the truth and the lie are easily interchangeable,

Great detective with double bottom. And while the main suspense is inflated somewhat tightened in the beginning, it is held in full normal. Unfortunately, the main Plot twist is revealed to the viewer before it is shown, it does not change the attitude towards the film. One of the best films to be released in EC.

A perfect thriller with a suspenseful script. Every detail is important, and getting distracted prevents you from guessing the end. The acting is flawless. You can sense the Sherlock Holmes effect in this movie because every character is brilliant in their own ways, but one person is like a genius solving a seemingly perfect crime.

reviews.review_title: Spanish Cinema releases a Detailed Study Material for Thriller Genre..
reviews.content: The Invisible Guest (2016) :Spanish Cinema releases a Detailed Study Material for Thriller Genre. Do you know the only thing Hitchcock thrillers lacked? The answer i believe is the details, and showing them even before you unfold the real thrill. You show the details even before starting to unfold the mystery and then the same details appear again just to make you realise that how you overlooked them in the first place. The Invisible Guest is a complete and a detailed study material for thriller lovers. It shows how to add sense in the thriller and just not letting it get away without human emotions. I have seen many mysterious films having revenge theory involve just because it should justify the overall plot and the Revenge should look mandatory. And it works because the culprit must be punished as we all believe. The Invisible Guest is about parents Revenge against a rich freak who got away using his powers. They plan a thrilling revenge to destroy him and then film keeps revealing shocking facts which were hidden since forever. In 106 minutes this film lacks loo breaks, it lacks loopholes (except for one or two emotional ones), it lacks slow pace and i hope you're getting what I'm trying to say non-affirmatively. It has everything set up nicely and most importantly clearly because cleverness is essential in modern thrillers otherwise we have option of lot of retro classics to enjoy on repeat mode. Spanish Cinema shows how to make a mind boggling thriller with implausible storyline to the world cinema. I have seen better revenge dramas, even more brutal than this but that doesn't take away anything from this film's status. The Invisible Guest triumphs in every cinematic aspect whether is it Acting, Writing, Technicality, Direction or Impact. A Classic thriller which should be remade again and again.RATING - 8/10*
I was sitting and not moving till the end of movie. What a movie!!! 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Deserves a spot among the top 10 of all time.
reviews.content: We found Badla first, couldn't get the subtitles right, and discovered this original. I'm not sure how anyone can rate this less than a 9.0. Seriously one of the best ten movies I've ever watched!
The movie is too long and stagnantthe main character is unseasonedthe ending is ''meh''

reviews.review_title: A treat for your brain cells !!!
reviews.content:
This is the best murder mystery I've seen so far. A treat for your brain cells. When the supposed lawyer proposes her theory of the murder events, things seem quite plausible. One gets the feeling of a good suspense finally revealed. But thats when we begin to realise there's more to the two characters in conversation than what appears. Back and forth of supposed truths and theories are exchanged, and we are introduced to one of the most theoretically entwined murder mysteries. And when the final reveal happens, one cannot help but feel overwhelmed by the underlying truth of the whole plot.
One of finest murder mysteries performed by brilliant actors.

Do not be fooled of the violence rating, yes there is blood occasionally and a car crash is pretty wild , the movie itself is superb, the cinematography too
The buildup story the plot everything, it's definitely worth watching in my opinion. The plot twist was mad.

Over the past few years I have notices that Spanish film industry is improving and becoming rather interesting and eye-catching! I lave the main actor Mario Casas was great in this movie. Also I can mention that the acting of all of the characters was great.The invisible guest, as any detective movie, has to be very precisely analyzed by the director and all the details has to be perfect in order to avoid plot holes. Here there are some, and one of them is when they take a train, we can see that it was an electric trail, but a few seconds later, we can see the characters standing near that train and in the background we can hear the sound of steam whistle. Allover, the film was great.Also, this is one of the few films, where you cannot get distracted even for a second as you will miss a very important detail.Loved this film very much !
The plot is full of twists and whenever you try to guess what happened , they shock you with an event ,a well-done thriller movie with an unexpected ending .

Mystery stories require the carefulness of the writer in compiling riddles, chronology, location details, and hidden clues. Furthermore, the director have to visualize the script into a mise en scene.The Invisible Guest perfectly packs the premise of a mystery into a thrilling and stunning. We knew that the mystery story will feel normal without a twist, and this movie is very brilliant to present a twist into the story.The acting of the players is executed carefully from the expression to the movements. Music scoring successfully fills an ambience of the mystery.
A smart show.

reviews.review_title: BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! Go the twists!
reviews.content: It has been a long time since I saw a film with so many twists. Maybe I've never seen a film with this many twists. It's quite possible. Or is it? Haha This film will leave you doubting everything and everyone by the end.It's superbly written and the pacing is phenomenal. There's so much going on in places that you really need to be paying attention. But it's written in such a way, that it sucks you in quickly, so your concentration naturally follows. When the twists start arriving, they each hit you like a tonne of bricks.The performances here are fantastic as well. Mario Casas has become my favourite Spanish actor after previously enjoying him in "The Photographer of Mauthausen" too. Some of the film locations were stunning as well.I generally think I'm alright at picking twists or solving these kind of films - but not this one. The incredibly intelligent way it was written kept me hopelessly guessing until the end. Probably not the best choice of film to watch when you're tired or wanting to switch your brain-off. It's best just to surrender yourself to it at the start and go along for the ride.I loved the ending and found it so satisfying! A must-watch for those into foreign language films and those who love a good twist or two!

reviews.review_title: Lies, infidelity and the power of the rich create a fantastic thriller
reviews.content: Directed by Oriol Paulo, "The Invisible Guest," or "Contratiempo" in its original language, is a fantastic Spanish film which combines suspense with a complicated puzzle that is both visually and intellectually stimulating. The film was released on January 6, 2017 and has a "MA" rating, most likely for the depicted scenes of violence and some language throughout. Themes of infidelity, lies, the power of the rich, and the fight between the rich and the poor are prevalent throughout. It's not a film you watch once. It's a gripping, suspenseful crime thriller that you must watch more than once to catch all of the small details.The movie starts off "in media res," or in the middle of action. The main character, Adrián Doria is being accused of murdering his mistress, Laura. Doria is played by actor Mario Casas, who recently starred in the Netflix film "El practicante" (2020) and does a spectacular job in both films. A renowned prosecutor, Virginia Goodman, has come to "save the day" and it is said that she's taken this as her last case before retirement. Doria's lawyer, Felix, hired her to help them win the case once and for all, making a dramatic entrance at the final hour. She tells Doria that they have 180 minutes to start over, and to figure out how he can win the case. But first, he has to tell the truth- the whole truth."The Invisible Guest" is dark. Not only in its themes but also with the cinematography. That's not a bad thing, and I think that it pairs well with the film as a whole. The lies throughout the film make everything darker and more confusing. I think this is a film that needs to be watched more than once. In the first run through, the ending is shocking. Then, as you watch it a second time already knowing the twist ending, you're able to pick up on the small details that make your really appreciate what Paulo put into making this film. At times, the twists can get confusing, which is another reason why it may be necessary to watch more than once. After getting past that and once you realize how all of the puzzle pieces fit together, the film comes together beautifully.The film has an interesting take on modern society, not just in Spain but throughout the entire world. The overarching theme, in my opinion, is the fact that the rich hold power over the poor. Doria is able to buy his innocence with a sketchy lawyer who makes things and details disappear. At the same time, Tomás, the father of a dead son, suffers with his wife who almost dies from the depressive state she's been put in. They struggle to get justice for their dead son, who was killed in a car accident by Doria and his mistress prior to his mistress being killed. Doria becomes "businessman of the year" and it is evident he has no money troubles. He's able to cover up the car accident and thought he would get away with it until him and Laura were "blackmailed." It's an interesting take, and a bold one at that. In the end, though, Doria get's what he deserves. But I'll leave you to watch the movie and see for yourself.As a college student majoring in Spanish, this film is perfect to watch and aid in learning the language. It's engaging and suspenseful, while also depicting the upper-class society of Spain. Overall, I do not have any huge complaints about the film- it's pretty solid all around. If I had to be picky, I would say that I wished Doria's wife, Sonia, played a little bigger of a role. I think there was a lot of potential to add to the mounting pile of lies, but it just fell a little short with that storyline. If you are a student looking for an interesting Spanish film as an aid to learning the language, this is the one for you. If you are a movie buff looking to add a solid crime thriller to your favorites, then this is the one for you also.

reviews.review_title: On the edge of my seat
reviews.content: Very few movies these days grip me enough where I don't check how long there is to go. This one was gripping the whole time. Full of twists and shocks. You could say some things were a little silly but overall I really enjoyed this movie as it wasn't predictable.
I don't understand why people gush so much over this movie. The characters get into trouble for making dumb "movie" decisions. I was frustrated from beginning to end.
It was so thrilling even though I predicted the twist of the film.Don't miss it.
Amazing story and brilliantly filmed . full marks to the cast and story writter.

"The Invisible Guest" is a Mystery - Thriller movie in which we watch a wealthy businessman who is also named Man of the Year due to his high-tech company being prepared from a veteran lawyer expert in witness preparation and judicial declaration to create a very strong defense. He has to do that because he was found by the police in a mountain hotel room with the corpse of his lover and was arrested. After that, he has to reveal all of his dark secrets to his lawyer in order for her to be able to help him.I liked this movie very much because it had an amazing plot with many surprises and many plot twists too. The direction which was made by Oriol Paulo was absolutely perfect and I wouldn't change anything about it, it had plenty of suspense and drama moments. Regarding the interpretations, I liked very much the interpretation of Mario Casas who played as Adrián Doria the wealthy and successful businessman and I have to say that he was the biggest surprise in this movie. Other interpretations that have to be mentioned were Bárbara Lennie's who played as Laura Vidal and of course Ana Wagener's who played as Virginia Goodman.Finally, I have to say that "The Invisible Guest" was a very big surprise because I didn't expect it to be such a great movie. I strongly recommend everyone to watch this movie either you are a fan of mystery movies or not because I am sure that you are going to enjoy it very much. It's an unexpected movie with many surprises and plot twists that will leave you speechless.

reviews.review_title: What a disappointment... Does not deserve its rating
reviews.content:
Far from good, this movie is barely more than a made-for-tv-movie... The plot is not new nor original... And the way it is handled is quite poor.Nothing, from the plot to the characters' reactions, seems very plausible...
Halfway through the movie, I had guest the ending...I've read there that Hollywood should take notes... I hope it does not.

My Rating : 9/10I was pleasantly surprised after a long time with a recent movie that belongs to the thriller/mystery genre. It is 'how' the story is told herein which makes it even more interesting. There have been hardly any good thrillers or horrors in recent times. The entire film industry seems to only concentrate on superhero, sci-fi or romcom dramas.The Invisible Guest starts off slow and then quickly picks up pace as all the pieces of the puzzle are slowly laid out and put together. While it isn't perfect by any means, it is an excellent and even emotional mystery drama at times.You could easily make a ten episode TV Series with this in the vein of True Detective and therefore it gets a solid 9/10 for delivering the same impact in a running time of under 2 hours.Must watch if you like thrillers.
A very tense experience; with an excellent plot, good performances and several unexpected moments; a very good thriller. TOTALLY RECOMMENDED!
Stop whatever you are doing right now & watch this movie!

Wow!
Just finished this up and I can honestly say this is one of the best thrillers I've seen in years.A witness preparation expert and a man accused of killing his lover have to work together to come up with an airtight defense.This film is just amazing. I loved every minute of it. The story is just enthralling. Just when you think you've got everything all figured out, things begin to twist and it happens more than once. This is what I am looking for in a great thriller.If you've not watched it, hesitate no longer!! It is worth it!!

reviews.review_title: It grabs you and won't let go
reviews.content: This story begins as a twisted but reasonable tale of people in a very bad situation who are forced to make a split-second decision, and they unfortunately choose the greater of two evils. However, the attorney's interrogation to help prepare the defendant's case quickly turns into a gripping blend of masterful storytelling, deceit, deduction, and powerful acting performances from both Casas (Adrian Doria) and Wagener (Virginia Goodman). By the conclusion, I was on the edge of my seat with eyes glued to the screen. Due to the nature of the story, I'm not sure if it's worth rewatching many times, but I'm excited to rewatch it at least once.

reviews.review_title: I'm so glad this movie is getting the love it deserves.
reviews.content: I had this movie in my watchlist for quite a while before I watched it. I don't know why I didn't watch it sooner. Mario Casas has been fantastic in all of his roles and he is what drew me to the movie.I love a film that you can sink your teeth into, makes you think, keeps you on your toes and this 100% delivered. Since the first time I watched it, I've had to go back and rewatch a certain part many times. The sequence is a masterclass of acting and directing. I'm sure you'll be in no doubt what I'm referring to once you've seen the film. Like Mario, all the other players put in convincing performances, particularly Ana Wagener.I wish more movies would suck me in as much as this one did.

Incredible Subject and Performance. I think Contratiempo are the top movie in 2016. I like Spanish movies. This is my first review for the movies on IMDb. It's way above the score it got and one of the smartest fictions I've ever seen. I used to love Spanish films anyway, and this has been added to my list of good films. Contratiempo is a production that should win awards for best screenplay and best director. The whole plot stays connected throughout the movie. I would like to express that it amazes me with its tension that increases as it progresses, its complete confusion of meaning towards the end, and its ending.

The story is very smooth. The "truth" behind the superficial case is revealed one after another from different perspectives. I think there are two problems, one is why the opposite surveillance has not been found before; the other is how the old couple knows about the lawyer. In addition, at the beginning of the film, several features were given to the newspaper. I always thought that the whole story was just made up by the male owner according to the contents of the newspaper.

reviews.review_title: One thought of heaven, one thought of hell.
reviews.content: The script is too wonderful, foreshadowing everywhere, layers of reversal, virtual and real crisscross, undercurrent surging. Those who think they are smart are often defeated, and those who are quiet can have the last laugh.

If you are not suspicious enough, have you guessed it? Didn't you guess that the lawyer is the mother and the boy is the child of that family? This is all the director puts out such a clear clue, tell you deliberately! Do you guess that behind the death of the mistress, there is the death of a young man? Did you guess the mistress told his parents about his death?

reviews.review_title: Had to Watch it Twice in a Row
reviews.content: I watch a lot of world cinema so I've been lucky to see good films beyond the caliber of simple Hollywood flicks. Contratiempo (or the Invisible Guest as it's also known) is suspenseful, well written and acted and superbly directed. Oriol Paulo is someone whose films I will watch no matter what. What a talent.

reviews.review_title: Riveting Spanish thriller that deserves more recognition
reviews.content: 'Contratiempo' is another impressive Spanish crime thriller that far exceeded my initial expectations. The film is intelligent and highly suspenseful with an intriguing plot and interesting, unpredictable characters. It follows the classic crime thriller format by keeping the audience guessing throughout, producing some unexpected twists, and slowly building pace and momentum throughout.Those who like their thrillers to be realistic may take issue with some parts of the film as it can be a little far-fetched at times, especially when it comes to the twists. In fairness, it's more easy to overlook some of the less convincing aspects of the plot because the film as a whole is so enjoyable and well-made. 'Contratiempo' is a riveting crime thriller that, while not totally convincing at times, makes up for it with its smart construction and compelling storyline.

reviews.review_title: What an outstanding movie with a brilliant plot.
reviews.content:
This movie keeps you occupied from the first minute, what seems to be a unfortunate incident, turns out in something massive.
Everytime you think that you know the answers on what happen, the storie changes and flips completely. Excellent.

Along the lines of other crafty films like Shutter Island, this film is a carefully plotted masterwork with interweaving alternative narratives. What is really going on? Who was responsible for what actions? The many alternative flashbacks show the subjective construction of the past with fantastic acting as every character is shown in completely different roles simultaneously. The audience is left on the edge of their seat with every new revelation until the ultimate finale. The only problem is the glaring plot holes which are described in the goofs section of this IMDb page. Otherwise I would have given it much higher!

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I had watched in years!!
reviews.content: Simply one of the best thrillers I had seen in years.Having watched 'The Body' before, and now this; Oriol Paulo is definitely a name ill never forget.This movie is simply great; the plot is captivating , the acting is great, the twists are wow, and the finale... I'm truly impressed.

I can't remember where I saw it... "the invisible guest" is like a beautiful but indescribable girl, with reasoning and structure, the girl took off her clothes layer by layer, and when the clothes finally came off, the girl puts on a new layer...

reviews.review_title: it's good, but a lot of people are fascinated because they only see mainstream hollywood movies - it's the only reason i can find.
reviews.content: This movie is a tense thriller, well directed and well acted. The first issues i see with it are the same ones i found in oriol paulo's "el cuerpo": a whole bunch of flashbacks to tell the story (here they're a bit more justifiable), a lot of twists and turns to trick the viewer some make sense some not that much, and again a car being crashed. I also didn't like much how they introduce the plot in the movie, they needn't to do that in such an obvious way. but anyway, these movies are not very different in form: again he can engage the viewer while the whole movie is almost only based in one location, again the pace is on point - and the views of bierge are pretty stunning.The second problems here...well a lot of "what ifs" first of all. He wants to trick us based on possibilities - and that's how he wants to keep you engaged - pretty much by guessing. the movie also requires a bit of suspension of disbelief but i'm kinda fine with that. the main problem is this: he's too focused on the ending that he doesn't care to make one or two narrative holes in order for the sotry to flow. again, i can understand but i don't think the ending is only what really matters in a movie. still it's a fun way to get there.now the ending...it's kinda predictable. ok you might not see it coming directly, but it's not hard to predict the last 10 seconds of the fim. not even the main revelation which is slightly before, but the last 10 seconds. the main problem of a lot of thrillers is that because they don't have that many characters you have to start guessing. that's not a bad thing per se, but since i saw el cuerpo recently i aso thught this one had a trick - i wasn't wrong.contratiempo is a good movie ,that but i dare to say a lot of people that were jawdropped when the finale was revealed probably are the ones discussing inception's ending - when it was pretty obvious nolan just wanted to play with the viewer. there are a lot of filmes where i was pretty stunned by the end - mostly because it makes you see the movie in a different light. this one made that but still i don't think it was thaat surprising.I'm going to give it an eight because it's indeed a good movie and a bit better than el cuerpo. plus it keeps you entertained while not being the best thriller in the world. being in top 250 imdb best movies doesn't make much sense though. i'm still going to see more oriol paulo's movies because get engaged with this type of films - even though this one is pretty much "el cuerpo" from another perspective. more believable none the less.
Do yourself a favour & see this film!! That's all I'm saying!! Don't forget to turn off your mobiles, you don't want any interruptions!! 👍👍👍👍👍

I have to say that I was taken completely by surprise by this taught little Spanish thriller. I haven't seen an even remotely good film in a while and I was beginning to think that I never would ever again.This started off so strong that I was almost sure that it would stumble into stupidity like so many others of this genre, throwing up red herrings right and left and yanking the viewer around like we were the fish on the hook.Contratiempo just got stickier and more complicated as the story evolved. Almost at every turn there is something so wicked that you gasp at the revelation. It was a lot of fun.I usually don't go for this sort of whodunit type of film. This one held my interest and didn't insult my (limited) intelligence.
Really enjoyed this movie. Made me think of the best Alfred Hitchcock movies. Topclass.

This it one of the most recent important movie for me because it is different and it takes different elements in one for creating a master police story.You should keep alert and conserve your eyes and your mind into this movie because you don't deserve that kind of final. Keep your eyes into it.

The big problem from non Hollywood movies are often budget related.
That's not a problem here.
The other one? They tend to try to look more artistic with longer shots, quieter moments, scenes to flesh out characters that aren't plot related... etc.
Which is great for some genres! But not for thrillers.
Here, they manage to be Hollywood like (really, super normal thriller crimen stuff)... But still surprise us with some things that require great writing (which Europe has). 
The acting though is what put this movie into great status. Every single actor was Amazing. 
Great, great movie.

All Oriol movies are the same. Men are bad, women are good. Men are violent murderers. A bad upper middle middle aged man causes a woman to be killed. Men cheat, men lie, and women are strong. There is a twist, and the bad man gets what is coming for him. Well, not really, depends if he is really hot and young or not. It seems that a businessman crossed Oriol when he was in the US, and since then he writes elaborate revenge movies that copy from De Palma, Hitchcock and even Shyamalan without reaching any heights related to these directors. His movies "seem" good (especially this one), but don´t resist a few seconds of analysis. Locations are nice, especially the train trip and hotel in Nuria.

reviews.review_title: Felt like a generic detective tv serie episode
reviews.content: Everything about it is generic and dull, i was really surprised considering the high ratings. I must start off my review of The Invisible Guest by mentioning that this is a movie where I had to pause and rewind frequently. While I have become more adept at reading subtitles and have found many foregin language films enjoyable, this one had dialogue that was coming rapid-fire at times. I kept missing lines, and because it is a mystery, I was afraid of missing anything that might be a vital piece of information. This isn't a detriment to the film, but perhaps a warning for those who also have difficulty with reading subtitles that are only on the screen for a few seconds. Aside from that I was utterly enthralled by The Invisible Guest. The plot is written so well, and is constantly revealing new layers of the story as you go. Perhaps the smartest move they make is having every single flashback scene reflect what is being said, even if there is some falsehood in it. This allows us to revisit key moments from a new perspective when the main character revises his story.It's hard to say much about The Invisible Guest without spoiling things, but I can say that I thought the cast was amazing. There was a lot of emotion that came out in the performances we see here, and Mario Casas was particularly brilliant. He plays a heavily-layered character that is reluctant to put his guard down, so it's intriguing to see the stages he goes through in this film as he is forced to tell the truth. Ana Wagener is the other notable actor in the film. Her determination is perfect for the role, and it was great watching how she was always a step ahead of Casas in every scene. I will say that I started to suspect what is revealed at the very end somewhat early on, but as with all the best mysteries, even when you figure out one piece there is still more to discover. I can't say much more about The Invisible Guest for fear of spoiling things. I would highly recommend that all fans of mystery/thrillers give this movie a try. It was completely satisfying for me.

***spoiler alert***
Updating Hitchcock is always a tempting and daunting task, in every moment, it seems. The temptation is, i suppose, easy to understand: Hitchcock's movies exist in a world of film. His stories (even when adpated from cheap novels) are always tailored to his camera, his camera to his eye, and his eye to his brilliant visual intuitions. In terms of narrative, his "stories" are always a game which invites several players on screen to participate, and always you, the spectator. But the secret is never in the facts of the story, never in the words, but in the image itself, in the movement of the camera. His camera is much more attached to character than, say, Welles', but much less than Scorcese's. Space plays a role, tells a story, the story is (admitedly) a McGuffin, in itself a useless device, that nevertheless grabs us. The game has the rules the storyteller defines, and once we the spectator enter it (that should happen even as the initial credits are still rolling), we don't have the possibility Not to play.Now we have Oriol Paulo updating Hitchcock. So far his best student had been De Palma, and for the moment it will remain in that spot, at least to me. But some things are interesting.Paulo understands the spliting of the space of the action. First we have the apartment room, overlooking the street, windows (eyes) on the other side. Remarkably old fashioned in its decoration, and even the objects (pen, chronometer, lighter, etc) are oldfashioned, a blink to Hitchcock's age. In the apartment the game is between the lawyer who must extract the truth from the ambiguous client and the client, whose sincerity (or lack of it) we don't get.The telling, re-telling, correcting and speculating of the story of what happened is where things get interesting. Through flashbacks we leave the room, and almost in Rashomon fashion, we watch over and over again the same bits of the important sotry elements. Who's right? Who's lying? Who is playing us, the audience? Most of those flashbacks are clumsy in how they are shot, they don't breathe well, they don't sit well in our ability to constantly re-create and change the memory of past events. That's a cinematic flaw. Most of the tension that we feel In the apartment room is gone when we move to the mountain roads or the hotel. I suppose that Hitchcock's feel of tension is often achieved through the physical limitations of the spaces where we are (think Vertigo, Rear Window, Rope, Strangers on a Train...) and thus the moutain, the open space of the flashbacks (with the obvious expection of the Kubrickan hotel) just won't do it. Where this also falls apart is in the main actor. He is so weak that the ambiguity of HIS character which should be central to this game is lost. He reveals everything as he thinks it is in each moment. Hitchcok never required a great deal out of his actors in order to make his films work, but he did need at least that they didn't get in the way. In a certain way Casas's character is the self-designated manipulator of the events, at least the character thinks he is. ***BIG SPOILER*** But he justs allows us to think too much, and follow the true master manipulation (the director of the apartment scene, whom we find out to be the fake lawyer).Anyway this is a relatively mechanical tale of suspense (tension through camera, expectaction, space), with bits of a game of spies (who is who, the biggest manipulator wears literally a mask). The sense of noir is all around, the sense that we are being played around, the coincidences (that the father of the dead kid is the one who picks up a co-conspirator). I want to see more of this director, this one is a nice exercise, i want to see him taking risks, i hope he does.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable mostly, but requires a LOT of suspension of disbelief
reviews.content:
Never explains where ordinary people managed to come up with super high-tech spy quality equipment.
Show scenes play out as each character is laying out possible events, only to have another character propose a different series of events which it also plays out for you, so by the end you've seen so many false narratives about what "might have happened" it actually becomes difficult to figure out what actually did happen. Not because it was clever, but simply because the truth was buried under a flood of imaginary scenarios that got shown to you as if they were real.
Tries to be super elaborate and clever, and gets a bit muddled. But in spite of that it's an interesting story and fun to try to figure out what really happened.Easy to get caught up in the imaginary "twists" but most of those are just made-up scenarios that never really happened as two characters try to manipulate each other into giving up truth. The actual twist doesn't come until the end, and although it's actually not very plausible it was still interesting and surprising (maybe more surprising because of not being very plausible, but still fun to watch.)
With some interesting twists however felt a bit rushed in the end.

reviews.content:
The old godfather in "The Godfather" tells the child to never let others know what you think.
When a person knows your true thoughts, that is your dead spot!The male owner thought he was quite bullish, pretended to be miserable, tested the lawyer's ability, and looked at the lawyer to help himself.
At first, the male owner must feel that he is in charge of the overall situation, guiding the lawyer and guiding her to follow her own ideas!
The fake female lawyer knew what was going on in her heart, and everything happened was clear, but she performed with him.
The male owner thought he was digging a hole for the lawyer, but he didn't expect the lawyer to dig a bigger hole for the male person! The purpose of the lawyer is very clear is to cheat his confession!Why did the male lead put everything out?
Fake female lawyers used several methods to lure confessions
1. Time-pressing method: start to count when you enter, stopwatch ticking ticking. Tell you a three-hour countdown! The man thought: irritability! Mess!
2. Halo method: I have never lost a lawsuit, and all the lawsuits I have won have been won. The male thought: Niu Ren!
3. Transfer the trust method: I was introduced by your cronies. Although we met for the first time, your cronies trusted me! The male master thought: I believe in him, he believes in her, I should believe in her!
4. Emergencies Act: Witnesses are here! You will be caught soon! The man thought: I'm gone, I'm done, I'm caught off guard!
5. Vision: I can protect you from prison! I want to convince the world that you are innocent! It's okay to listen to me! The male thought: This is what I want!
6. Demonstration ability: from time to time show your strong reasoning ability. Although all the information is known to fake lawyers, it feels as if the male owner has just inferred it, and the thought is: I went, I did n't tell you, how do you know? Suddenly admire the five body cast!
7. Fighting hard: If you want to avoid homicide, you have to admit the traffic accident! If you want to blame your mistress, you must tell me the location of the sinking car, so I can fake it! In fact, the purpose is to allow the male owner to admit that he is involved in a traffic accident and tell the location of the sinking car. The male owner thought: Well, I can escape the blame when I say it, so good!
8. To threaten the law: if you don't want to be in prison, you have to listen to me! If you do n't want to have nothing, you have to conceal it, acknowledge it!

If you liked:
Prisoners
Gone Girl
The Girl with the Dragon TattooI love detective movies. Like many, I'm a huge fan of the Sherlock Holmes books, series and films; and detective is probably the most enjoyable movie genre for me. I love the way they challenge your mind, and I love trying to predict the outcome before "the big reveal". But nowadays its just extremely hard to find a truly good detective story; either all of them are filled with clichés, or are too unserious and "jokey". But "The Invisible Guest" is an overlooked detective masterpiece.One of the few Spanish movies I've seen, it has the grim atmosphere of "Gone Girl" and story quality and complexity worthy of Sherlock. I obviously cannot tell much about the plot without spoiling everything to oblivion, but in general it's a story of a man falsely accused of murder, who has only a couple of hours to prove his innocence. The multilayered storyline demands your attention every second, and plot twists will leave you with you mouth wide open. A modern detective story that still manages to stay classy. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: It twists and turns like a ...twisty-turny thing
reviews.content: " you twists and turns like a ...twisty-turny thing" is a line from Curtis and Elton's 1980's sitcom "Blackadder II". And this Spanish mystery thriller is certainly the most "twisty-turny" thing I've seen in a while.Set in an atypical Spain made of coniferous forests and mountain resorts, in which a rich businessman and his lover are forced to deal with an unwanted and unforeseen event. Wrong decisions are made leading to guilt and fear while the mystery of what really happened thickens and changes at each turn until it spirals down to its climax. I said spirals, there are so many plot twist in rapid succession that the film ends up spinning. The film is structured in an almost "Rashomon" style where different possible solutions to the mystery are shown in flashback. Ideally the viewer should be trying to work out its own solution as well before the final plot twists are unleashed on us. Once a thriller becomes predictable it looses its appeal and The Invisible Guest (Contratiempo) by Oriol Paulo seems on a mission to baffle us till the very end.

reviews.review_title: Nice plot idea but maybe a missed opportunity

Story itself seems a bit far-fetched (including the final reveal and the omniscient defense attorney) while the true and (many) false versions of the story are laid out in quite a tangled manner that leaves the audience perplexed and makes it very difficult to follow. Would be an excellent movie otherwise.

reviews.review_title: Good part of an ongoing process
reviews.content: A quite intriguing, fascinating film that kept me at high alert at many points and I felt true agony and anxiety. Using a downplayed and somewhat gloomy photography, as light is not prevalent in the film, combined with the dark atmosphere of the events, the uncertainty and many illusions of the film are excellently projected. Its great use of winter and forest surroundings adds special colour to the film, something like a countryside taste which could fit any European country. Corruption and social variations form part of the support means of the plot, creating a contrast between the middle-aged couple with a comfortable but quiet and conventional living style and the glamorous world of modern business and art, mixed with conspiracies and secrets, supported by unscrupulous lawyers and magistrates. The film uses elements of Agatha Christie novels, such as the many twists of the plot, and also themes from Hitchcock epics, for instance long, prolonged, scenes filled with uncertainty and fear. It deserves viewing and I hope to see even better from the director, as I suspect he can make an even subtler, scarier and nail-biting crime mystery- thriller. I am sure he still stands on the middle steps of the ladder, having though already accomplished honourable results.

reviews.review_title: My brother thinks he can fooled me. Ha!
reviews.content:
Okay so I watched the invisible guest because my brother told me it was the best plot twist and that I wont see it coming.
Yeah okay so I didnt immediately guessed it but guess what? I noticed that the lady lawyer and the mother are the same person, I mean, how come nobody saw this? I asked my brother about this and he fell silent LOL. And halfway through the movie, you can kinda see the plot twist coming.I rarely venture out of english speaking movie, aside from asian movies, I could count by hand the number of foreign film I've watched before. Last time I watched 365dni and I regret it. But this movie was very good, the structure and the unreliable main character was the selling point here, the way they build the web of lies and the deconstructure of those lies are very compelling. To me, This wasnt a thriller movie, this played out more like a detective movie.
Though from the title 'The Invisible Guest' I thought that this was a horror/ghost movie.
And there are some moments where it feels
a bit dragged out, I understand that it was to build tension and suspense but to me it was just a bit too long and unnecessary.
The plot twist to me wasn't the revelation that our main character is fooled by the lady lawyer or that laura wasn't actually the mastermind behind it all but rather the fact that the young guy wasn't actually dead when he was about to be drowned. Now that is cold blooded. This moment right here was the true unmasking of a human nature, how low can you go to cover your tracks, even when you think you've hit your lowest point, the thing you tried to hide wasn't actually the worst thing that you could do. How far can you go? Apparently even further down.Well, Expectations exceeded and this movie deserves major props. Most definitely would recommend this movie to other people.At the end of the movie, gave myself a pat on the back and a note for myself to check more foreign movies from spain.

reviews.review_title: !!!!! POSSIBLE FRAUD regarding Ratings and Reviews !!!!!
reviews.content: I watched the movie. It was my 991st rating on this website. And this is my very first review. I felt extremely misguided by the 8.1 rating witch this movie had when I watched it. I checked all 436 so far written reviews for this movie. Do the same for ~5 Minutes and you will see the pattern how most of the 9/10 and 10/10 are constructed. It repeats itself very quick. I believe this rating is manufactured. Maybe they are paying for upvotes and good reviews or somebody involved with this movie profits from a better rating.This movie was a mediocre 5/10. That was my first, intuitive reaction. But then I started reading all the over the top positive reviews and got suspicious. You should do the same. You might safe 2 hours of your life time.

reviews.review_title: A little thought of the beginning
reviews.content: It is absolutely fair to say the suspense is great all throughout the show. However, I had some concern about the beginning of the cover-up.According to the final version of "fact", the boss directed everything, and apparently he has a strong stroke of egoism. But, the decision he made not to call the police was quite weird for me at first sight, which may indicates a classic impression of rich alpha males.So, as compared to all the follow-up uncovered, what would happen if police knows of the event at the outset? Since the venerable mom didn't refer to the accident itself, we could take it as a true condition, based on which it is reasonable for the boss to insist his innocence and blame the deer. Another detail backing this approach is the unnoticeable dent on the front of the car, which leads to the fact that there is no direct clash between two cars, though the boss' reaction toward this emergency definitely results in what then happens to the poor boy.But, from the perspective of the boss, this cover-up may seems quite reasonable. Given that he unswervingly believe the positive consequence of a cover- up, which means no disturbance from the police and, more important, no harm to the promising career of an upstart entrepreneur, every otherwise plan just doesn't offer enough benefit to pay off the cost. Therefore, it is indeed, according to the mom, sheer foolishness about his control of the world that leads him to this fiasco. Sad! P.S.: I wonder what would happen if the true lawyer devise another plan to repudiate all unveiled evidence? No quite probable?

reviews.review_title: How many plot twists can a movie take?
reviews.content: Although out of the Hollywood style with explosions and fierce pursuits, and even without being inspired by some classic literature, the modern Spanish production, "The invisible Guest" (2016), takes your breath away every minute during the time you are watching it, and even after.The plot revolves around the preparation of an iconic and respectable businessman for his trial after being accused of the murder of his paramour. With an innocent, yet unbelievable and full of "holes" story, the details that are questioned and explained to successfully fill them in the future trial are the beginning and the middle of a new and complex web of facts and lies related to another unfortunate crime.Focusing on a single and luxurious apartment that serves as a place for various memories and flashbacks, the narrattive of just under two hours in length takes you constantly to an infinite number of paths, hypotheses and opinions. All surprising and questionable, but without loose ends.The movie is a gradual and incessant suspense. The absence of action scenes is filled by the lack of any kind of monotony, either by the great script or by the alternation of expressions of its actors. Filled with doubts and reasoning, the work is no purely intellectual questioning, but rather, a thriller that makes you frantically look at and exchange targets of hatred and sympathy as the plot progresses or makes you think you are moving towards an imaginable or simple ending.After the conclusion of the work, perhaps one or another idea that appeared in the viewer's mind during the course of the plot is similar to some of the various assumptions that the story makes you raise. However, the intensity of the surprise and anxiety it generates will leave you with a tightness in your chest and a round of applause for the production.'The invisible guest" is a movie that makes you want to advance in time to discover its end soon, but that prevents you from doing so due to the uninterrupted increase in the quantity and quality of discoveries and plot twists.

reviews.review_title: Great Movie, whether you're Spanish or not.
reviews.content:
The Invisible Guest (or Contratiempo) is a spanish thriller directed by the famous director and screen writer Oriol Paulo. In this movie (released in January of 2017), we find Adrían Doria, a sucessful businessmen who is arrested for the suspected murder of his lover, Laura Vidal. Adrían hires one of the best defense attorney's, Virginia Goodman to help prove his innocence.
Throughout the movie, we find out that he is involved, along with Laura, in a cover up murder of a man named Daniel Goodman. Adrían hides details from the events that transpired from Virginia in order to try to save himself. During the movie, we are informed of the real truth regarding all of this, but are still left hanging of the edge of our seat till the very end. Just when you think you have figured it out, Oriol will throw another twist at you that you did not expect.
The music during this movie conveys a message of suspense as well as mystery which makes you want to keep watching. The cinematography is dark shots which adds to the suspense even further. I believe that the central message is that you cannot hide from your past and in the end justice will be done. Adrían is trying to cover up his past throughout the movie, but Virginia is able to piece the story together and we learn the truth.
I believe that there are few mistakes in this movie, and overall it is one that you must watch over and over agin (Similar to inception) in order to fully understand it. I would encourage anyone who loves thrillers to give this movie a watch, it is well worth your time

reviews.review_title: Review of The Invisible Guest (Contratiempo), directed by Oriol Paulo.
reviews.content: The Invisible Guest (Contratiempo) written and directed by Oriol Paulo, is a Spanish thriller starring Ana Wagener as lawyer Virginia Goodman, and Mario Casas, as businessman Adrian Doria. The film is strategically delivered in the inverted pyramid style - the crux of the story is made out to be the most crucial and most telling, but all it is is the straw that broke the camel's back. Businessman Adrian and his lover Laura are found by police in a remote hotel room in Spain. Adrian has been knocked unconscious by an unknown intruder and Laura has been bludgeoned to death with a very heavy concrete sculpture. None of the other hotel guests see anyone leave or go into that room, so the police pin the crime on Adrian. He claims he is innocent. This is not the pinnacle of the plot though. Everything that allowed Adrian and Laura to come to the hotel room is. Enter Lawyer Virginia Goodman (Wagener) who is highly regarded in her field. She hasn't lost a single defence case yet. Inside Adrian's apartment riveting dialogue between these two characters unravels, and it is questions after questions after question. Answer after answer after answer. It is interrogative, engaging and fast moving. With this dialogue, viewers are given the backstory. We know Virginia is good - she is the lawyer who will get Adrian off the hook. While she tests him for holes in his story she too is being tested - can he trust her and is she smart enough to pull off his defence in a court of law? It is here when the perspective of the movie is shifted, and the perspective on the facts of the case change, at the desires of Virginia herself. She verbally puts Adrian into the jury's shoes. She shows him what they will see and she presents his case back to himself in a way that has the potential to suggest he is guilty of murdering his lover. He is enraged - his guilt has been discovered by his lawyer and he doesn't like it. It is at this point Oriol Paulo has masterfully played with angles and perspective, and has allowed us to realise we have been deceived. We have been deceived this whole time. How stupid we were. We thought Adrian was innocent! When dialogue is that quick, crafted, and precise, many outcomes are plausible. Many facts of a crime can be skewed and delivered on a different silver platter and still be plausible. At this point we are completely entranced, and want to know more. We thought he was innocent. Could he really be guilty? Guilt never crossed our minds. How blind we were. Screenplays and the facts of a crime have one thing in common: anything can be twisted and changed and still make sense in the end. Oriol Paulo knows there's more than one way to skin a cat. Ten out of ten. Amazing, thought-provoking and definitely worth watching, again and again.

reviews.review_title: Basically a live-action "Detective Conan" special - and nothing special
reviews.content: If anyone is familiar with the very popular manga/anime "Case Closed" aka "Detective Conan", this is a sort of similar movie, with the same kind of twists and the ultimate reveal at the end. The anime TV series ran for over a thousand episodes now, and while i have only watched a fraction, many of them had equally good twists as this movie, some were even similar. Even the "block of ice" thing, yeah they've done exactly that before as well.Now, this is a reasonably entertaining little movie with a smaller budget (but still looking good) and decent acting, but nothing too special and nothing spectacular. Certainly not something to give 10 stars for, when a popular weekly anime series has twists and reveals of similar calibre pretty regularly. And that anime is itself heavily influenced by "Sherlock Holmes", so it's just an example of such a "whodunit" type of content. So if you think this is some groundbreaking, jawdropping stuff that warrants a 10/10, maybe you haven't seen as much of this kind of content yet, otherwise the rating would end up being far more level-headed.

Though the story can be difficult to follow some of the time, flashback within a flashback, the director - and screenwriter - of this movie shows great talent for telling a suspenselful tale with twists, turns and revelations that you might not have expected and that will leave you wanting more-The color palette reminds you of David Fincher. The tempo, story and rhythm reminds you of Christopher Nolan and the setup of the film reminds you of an old noir.Watching this movie I was quite excited and on the edge of my seat for certain parts of the film. The director shows great control in working with suspense and at hinting details for the characters, and for the audience, to pick up on. It's a great ride trying to figure out who did what along with Adrián Doria and Virginia Goodman. The story is well constructed and the characters are very well written. All of them are three dimensional and as we get to know them better for each minute we understand their reasoning and motivation.The color palette reminds you of Davin Fincher, but I do sometimes wish that the director, Mr. Oriol Paulo, would have turned down his visual style in turn for focusing on the plot since it often took me out of the story a bit.The feature is well crafted, but it could be occasionally be challenging to know exactly where a certain scene would take you - but I guess that's the point as well, to make the audience feel confused. This does just not always work very well as I could feel myself trying to figure out what is up and down instead of following the story.I did not know much about this film before watching it and therefore it also took me sometime to figure out what the plot was and who the important characters were. There were many and it was troublesome to keep track on them for the first half hour of the film, also because it jumped back and forth in time and what not.It is an entertaining movie with a super interesting premise and it is a film that will make you think as much as it bewilders and shocks you. I was surprised at how much I enjoyed it.It is clear that the director is inspired by the classics as well as American film directors, but I am looking forward to seeing him develop his own style and discovering his coming films in the future.If you are in the mood for a time-jumping, unpredictable movie with twists and turns, I can recommend this one.//A humble fan of films
